description: Ghosts, graveyards, hangings and haunts. From the old military town of York to the metropolitan city of today, discover Toronto's darker history. Stroll along the haunted cobblestone streets of the historic Distillery District by lantern light. Visit the old hanging grounds near the St. Lawrence Market, where many a rebel, and perhaps a few innocent souls, met with a gruesome end.

reviews.title: A very creepy experience and worth it for the price
text: Lauren did an awesome job! We didn't have anything crazy but it's not like they can control that; for only $27/person it was worth it. I might have been disappointed with the lack of activity if it was more expensive, but it was very good value for the cost. The atmosphere was super creepy and the stories were great.

The only place that felt active for me was the Burwick House. Half of our group could hear creaking and movement coming from upstairs, and some of us (myself included) also heard crying. I don't think I was imagining it, because I didn't experience anything anywhere else. Upstairs was eerie and uncomfortable, especially the room with the cradle. I felt a heaviness on my back and chest that only lifted when we left the house. I was with my fianc√© and he didn't experience any of this, so I guess it's very individual.

reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered around Halloween. üéÉ
text: Just did the tour with Tory (hope I spelled her name right), an awesome & informative tour. I have been on a lot of tours and this one was excellent. Thanks for a wonderful evening.   I definitely will book again.

reviews.title: Too many people in the tour at Black Creek
text: The ghost stories and the village after dark were quite good, however the group we were in was much too large. It made it very difficult to focus on what the guide was telling us, and all those flashlights ruined the spooky atmosphere. At on point, I couldn't hear what was being said over the voice of one guest.
There were a total of 24 people in our group - this crowded the buildings we did enter.
Our guide was very good and did their best to make this work - kudo's to Sare!
I'd recommend booking a much later tour, and hope for a smaller group that way.

reviews.title: Disappointing and quite boring
text: This was one of the most boring things I've paid money for. The history of the buildings was interesting but we only went in 4 and the "stories" got old and there was absolutely nothing spooky about it.

reviews.title: Enthralling and Curated
text: The tour was very engaging and the stories were very well told and curated for the audience. Will definitely explore more!

reviews.title: Excellent and enjoyable city tour.
text: Thomas is a great story teller and made the tour very engaging. Telling the main story in parts throughout the tour which kept ending on cliff hangers helped shape the experience in a really interesting way. It was so interesting to hear the history of the city through people‚Äôs lives and experiences. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Disappointing
text: Fabulous ambiance and interesting to hear about the history of the homes.  I do, however, feel we should have been able to see all of the buildings like the Mill & the Halfway House (another tour group was able to explore these buildings) and also allow for our own investigation in the buildings,  without such a large group.  Disappointing...not in the least bit scary.

reviews.title: Ask for Sare if you want a good scare!
text: Sare was an excellent guide and was very great at telling the spooky history of the place. Walking the villiage at night was really cool. Only downside is there‚Äôs so many groups doing different things around the villiage it gets distracting and detracts from the spooky vibes.

reviews.title: Shooketh in the Burwick house.
text: The haunt was very spooky and fun and our guide Lauren was amazing at telling us the tails of all of the houses on our walk. Everything took a turn when we entered the Burwick house. As we were listening to the story, we heard a loud crash and we all screamed and ran for our lives. The dead gave us signs they were in the house, and ultimately made the experience worth it. I will never be the same again.

reviews.title: Fantastic!!
text: Cass was a fantastic tour guide! He was very entertaining and knowledgeable! Would highly recommend far anyone who is visiting and wants more history of the area!

reviews.title: I loved the Haunted Walk with Clarice!
text: Clarice was my tour guide and she was great. I was the only one on the Haunted Walk tour (seeing as it is mid-November I wasn‚Äôt too surprised) but it was really such a great experience. It was immersive, interesting, and I learned a lot. The stories really made you think about the histories of the buildings. As a paranormal enthusiast, I had such a great time and I can‚Äôt thank Clarice enough. I will definitely be going back!

reviews.title: Nothing scary about this walk.
text: There is nothing scary about this haunted walk. Waste of money honestly. Y‚Äôall shouldn‚Äôt even charge this much for just a storytelling.

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: My boyfriend and I came here for the 6:15 PM Ghost tour!
Our tour guide, Mia, was incredible and very nice.

She would always state facts in response to the comments that some of the guests made. For instance, in the Burwick house, as you reach the top floor, it gets very hot. Some guests were curious about this, and Mia explained that pioneers built their homes in a way to insulate heat. I appreciated Mia ‚Äúdebunking‚Äù certain feelings/situations as to show that not everything experienced should be passed off as paranormal.

However, when we were in the Manse house, Mia‚Äôs lantern began to randomly flicker, dimming and then shining bright. She said that it must be dying batteries, but her lantern was fine everywhere else outside the Manse house. I kept thinking about that throughout the tour.

Because I have never myself experienced any sort of ghostly activity, I tried to keep an open-mind and anticipated that if I were to witness anything, that I would attempt to debunk it. While touring the church, Mia explained that people have witnessed orbs floating in the cemetery. I was not nervous, or panicking when she said this as I know that can affect how people begin to perceive/see things thereafter. I just absorbed her information and we moved along.

When we toured the cemetery from the front gate, I was shining my flashlight that was given to us for the tour, towards the tombstones, and I had randomly seen a random ball of whitish/blue light float down from a tree near the front of the cemetery all the way down to the front gate. Now, I tried to keep mouth shut about it because I didn‚Äôt want people to think that I was reacting just to ‚Äúreact.‚Äù But, I could not stay quiet, because the natural human response to seeing something unexplainable is to say ‚ÄúWhat the f-!‚Äù Lol.

I promise you guys that this was not dust, a bug, a leaf, or car lights. I also thought about it possibly being someone else‚Äôs flashlight, but I debunked this. A flashlight being shone out does not form a perfectly round circle mid-air, unless it has something to reflect off of in the background. In which this case, the cemetery was open field. Everyone‚Äôs flashlights just casted a wave of light, not small round circles.

This orb was perfectly spherical and moving on its own accord, despite the wind (the wind would affect the direction that a bug or leaf would move, and the car lights would have had nothing to reflect off of, this was floating in mid air) as it had randomly appeared from the tree and had floated down to the front gate and disappeared. When I had seen it, I froze and said ‚ÄúOh my God! I just seen something float down!‚Äù Mia turned to me and asked what was it, and I explained as above. She assured me that she believed me and encouraged me to continue to keep an open mind.

I continued shining my light, but it did not reappear and I can affirm that I had definitely seen a spirit orb. I did not feel afraid or nervous, it just felt surreal and I took that experience home with me.
Thank you Mia for such an amazing tour! 5 stars! üòä

reviews.title: Haunted and Delighted
text: I have been living in Toronto for over a decade and it was a very joyful and pleasant experience to learn about the history of places and buildings that I have passed by so many times. Sare, our tour guide's theatrical story telling made the tour so much more interesting.

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: Jack is a wonderful storyteller and answered all of our questions. We had a great time! We even experienced noises and the chain swinging upstairs in the Stong home.

reviews.title: Soft spirits
text: Good informative tour, friendly guide, lots of history and insights into 19th century Toronto society. It was engaging and fun, but not spooky. The distillery is a wonderful site with lots of benign ghost anecdotes but few murders or truly morbid stories.

reviews.title: Creepy but fun!!!
text: We had a great time. Clarice was a great guide and made sure to make it extra scary by inviting ghosts to join us. We even seemed to have captured one on camera. This one was by the cemetery. And no one was there in front of the camera.

reviews.title: Just Okay
text: The tour/stories wasn't as scary as I'd hoped. Lots of historical facts but I came for the spooks!
Plus there were other group members that kept talking and laughing throughout the tour guide's presentation.

reviews.title: A spooky and enjoyable tour!
text: My spouse and I have done 3 haunted walks over the years and this one was by far the best. Our guide Kate was very knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and a great storyteller.

Since this tour involves going into the buildings and exploring, the probability that you will experience something unexplained goes up by orders of magnitude. Everyone in our group heard a loud bang when there was absolutely no one upstairs, which was something that even the most die hard skeptic would be hard pressed to explain.
I would definitely revisit this tour again next year, and would like to make it an annual tradition. Two thumbs up!

reviews.title: Great city walk
text: Great stories and amazing walk through the city.  I got stood up in Nashville and almost gave up on tours like this.  This tour restored my passion for this type of entertainment

reviews.title: Excellent Tour
text: We did this when we visited in April. Despite it being a rainy night  and myself, my partner, and our 21 year old being the only people booked, it was excellent.  The guide was very knowledgeable  and was able to tell us about the rich history of the area whilst  combining this with ghost stories and experiences of people. I would highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Super informative, fun and spooky tour of the beautiful university campus!
text: The University of Toronto Ghost Tour - Campus Secrets & Spectres was amazing! Very informative and entertaining! Our guide Risha was super amiable and generously answered all of our many questions! The company was very accommodating for our last minute needs and requests! We highly recommend this tour of the university's beautiful campus!

reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyable!
text: The tour started right on time. Vivian was a wonderful storyteller throughout the entire evening. There were so many fantastic places to see and stories to hear!

reviews.title: Just a lot of Spooky Fun, We Loved Paul
text: We had Paul, who aside from being fantastic had an amazing accent from across the pond. He really made the tour ... overall a great tour with fun and spooky stories. We had a really good time

reviews.title: Great fun
text: Great stories that were well told by our guide Monts. This tour was just over an hour and took us to a variety of different sites around the city centre.

reviews.title: Learn the dark past about Toronto after dark!
text: The meeting point for this one takes you right to the guides, we had Lauren who was an excellent story teller throughout and her character on the tour made the experience extra special.

She took us to lots of interesting points throughout the city all within walking distance and told us of the chilling stories which happened at each spot we visited, she also showed us historical points on the way and explained to us the history of Toronto. The tour itself was a good length in both journey and time and you learnt a lot of history along the way including all the stories and hauntings which have been known throughout the city. From this I have learnt not to goto the toilet alone in Toronto and why girls go in pairs :D
Make sure you take a jacket and wear comfy shoes for this one.

reviews.title: Great time learning stories of the Haunted history of Toronto
text: This was an amazing experience.  Wanted to thank Lauren so very much for he wealth of knowledge and the passion in which she told the stories of the different locations.  Thanks again Lauren you were great!!

reviews.title: Spooky stories!
text: This was a spooky cool way to tour the city. I would  definitely recommend it to anyone who likes spooky stories and history.

reviews.title: Inexplicable happenings and spooky fun at Black Creek Pioneer Village
text: I‚Äôve done most of the haunted walks in Toronto, Kingston and Ottawa and enjoyed them all. A great way to learn some history, get some exercise and hear spooky stories. Last night was atmospheric for a walk around the old buildings at Black Creek Pioneer Village, with a bright beautiful moon and chill in the air. I haven‚Äôt experienced anything on any of the prior walks, but odd things started in the very first building we entered when a chain that blocks off entrance to a bedroom started swinging back and forth on its own while the guide was talking. Nobody was near it at the time. Then in the ‚ÄúMinister‚Äôs house‚Äù I was the last person to enter and had to close the door. I paused to look around while doing so. There were only 4 of us in the group plus our guide and everyone had already moved on into the house to the right when I heard a loud bang in the room to my left, which is blocked off. It sounded like someone banging their fist on a desk or table and I thought someone had gone around to prank me. However, no one had, and there wasn‚Äôt another way into the room. I tried to re-create the sound, looked for a fallen item etc but couldn‚Äôt figure out what made the noise. The third odd thing is a photo I took in front of a house. All the photos I took turned out fine, except for one that came out a bit blurry despite taking in in the same way as the others. This photo shows a blue streak of light and what looks like a horse galloping out of the front door. All in all, an entertaining evening!

reviews.title: Recommend Katie!
text: We had Katie and she was awesome! I would highly recommend her and this tour! She was very informative and entertaining.

reviews.title: Great tour
text: Great way to learn some of the haunted history of Toronto. Our guide Kayle was awesome! She was friendly, knowledgeable and took time to make sure everyone was enjoying the tour.

reviews.title: Haunted haunts
text: Kaylee was tons of fun and very knowledgeable.  Her love of haunted haunts is very evident. The history runs deep in old York.

reviews.title: Great tour with interesting stories!
text: This was our first visit to Toronto and most  of our group had ever experienced a haunted walking tour. Our group was adults, teens, and as young as 11, and everyone had a great time! The history and stories were really interesting and we had a great tour guide. We would recommend this tour if you‚Äôre in the area.

reviews.title: Great Haunted Walking Tour
text: This was an excellent tour. Was fun to walk around the city and explore haunted history.  Our guide, Vivian, was excellent.  She was professional and a great story teller.  It was her last tour with the company. They are losing a gem.  Good Luck Vivian on your new adventure!

reviews.title: Great time with spooky Toronto Tour
text: Kit was amazing.  We were the only two on the tour.  She made it very interesting and fun for us.  She went way out of her way to accommodate us even walking us back to our starting spot at the end of the tour.

reviews.title: Kinda disappointed
text: Would have been better without the wedding going on in the background. As well as the escape room patrons running and screaming everywhere opening doors. Too many experiences happening at the same time. Took away from the atmosphere. Was a little disappointed.

reviews.title: Amazing and Very Spooky!!
text: My wife and I went on this tour and it was absolutely fantastic! Cate created such an incredible atmosphere that had us both completely immersed in the history and the mystery of Black Creek Pioneer Village. If you enjoy the paranormal, history, spookiness, or are even just searching for a unique experience, don't waste any more time searching and book asap!

reviews.title: A fun evening outing
text: The tour guide was personable, helpful, and knowledgeable . The stories were fun. It was great to see more of old Toronto and hear its history.

reviews.title: Interesting evening.
text: Had a very interesting evening guided by Vivian.  Lots of knowledge passed on and saw bits of Toronto you would not normally notice. The tour took about 75 minutes and was a different way to spend an evening. Vivian was a lovely young lady and a pleasure to meet.

reviews.title: Great fun!
text: Paul was great! He was knowledgeable about the city and its history as well as being a very entertaining storyteller. Would gladly go again!
